header.text: 62 Org (systems integration, does not reply to Chatter) to GUS Only

messageSegments.text: ​  - For the org signup templates that are missing the permission for "Enable running and building of joined reports in Lightning" I feel we need to address this first or we go to the point of continuing this problem. We need to identify the exact criteria for what orgs should have this enabled or not also. At least one PE template has neither this or Enable Joined Reports enabled.

​  - This is for the Mass Org Update Tool action - it's not completely straight forward but it's the advised way to go about this so ideally we want to go this round once #1 is addressed. We could always do #2 first but we end up having to do it a second time if we don't fix #1.

body.text:
##################################################
Closing Summary:
I've logged two bug records
1) W-6249234​  - For the org signup templates that are missing the permission for "Enable running and building of joined reports in Lightning" I feel we need to address this first or we go to the point of continuing this problem. We need to identify the exact criteria for what orgs should have this enabled or not also. At least one PE template has neither this or Enable Joined Reports enabled. 
2) W-6249267​  - This is for the Mass Org Update Tool action - it's not completely straight forward but it's the advised way to go about this so ideally we want to go this round once #1 is addressed. We could always do #2 first but we end up having to do it a second time if we don't fix #1.
##################################################

messageSegments.text: "Enable running and building of joined reports in Lightning"
PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = Enable running and building of joined reports in Lightning

SELECT Account,Active,CreatedDate,Id,Name,OrganizationType,PermissionsLightningJoinedReports,PermissionsMultiBlockReporting,Status FROM AllOrganization WHERE PermissionsMultiBlockReporting = True AND PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = False
Forgot a filter for active orgs

SELECT Account,Active,CreatedDate,Id,Name,OrganizationType,PermissionsLightningJoinedReports,PermissionsMultiBlockReporting,Status FROM AllOrganization WHERE PermissionsMultiBlockReporting = True AND PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = False AND Status = 'ACTIVE'

body.text:
AllOrganizations table 
PermissionsMultiBlockReporting = Enabled Joined Reports
PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = Enable running and building of joined reports in Lightning
 
[Crossed-out text: SELECT Account,Active,CreatedDate,Id,Name,OrganizationType,PermissionsLightningJoinedReports,PermissionsMultiBlockReporting,Status FROM AllOrganization WHERE PermissionsMultiBlockReporting = True AND PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = False]
 
[Crossed-out text: Shows 17k orgs~]
 
Forgot a filter for active orgs
 
SELECT Account,Active,CreatedDate,Id,Name,OrganizationType,PermissionsLightningJoinedReports,PermissionsMultiBlockReporting,Status FROM AllOrganization WHERE PermissionsMultiBlockReporting = True AND PermissionsLightningJoinedReports = False AND Status = 'ACTIVE'
 
It's 15.8k Active orgs~

messageSegments.text: Assigned To from Core-CCE-Teal to Shane Porter

header.text: W-6240992 — Jim Pan changed Assigned To from Core-CCE-Teal to Shane Porter and Status from New to Acknowledged.

messageSegments.text: ​ Per our discussion earlier today, here is the investigation regarding enabling joined reports in LEX.

body.text: @Yiming Qi​ @Raghav Ravichandran​ Per our discussion earlier today, here is the investigation regarding enabling joined reports in LEX.

messageSegments.text: ​. The PERM we have here is "neverProvisioned". So, when a customer upgrades, we need someone to enable this feature on BT correct?

​ I guess that means we have no other way than to enable the perms manually for all the orgs. If there is a way to ensure that, when an org becomes one of the five editions that I have specified, it should automatically try and provision the PERM, we should do that.

body.text: Thanks for the clarification @Theresa Vietvu​. The PERM we have here is "neverProvisioned". So, when a customer upgrades, we need someone to enable this feature on BT correct? @Shane Porter​ @Anusha Surepeddi​ I guess that means we have no other way than to enable the perms manually for all the orgs. If there is a way to ensure that, when an org becomes one of the five editions that I have specified, it should automatically try and provision the PERM, we should do that.

messageSegments.text: ​ Can you share any documentation on how this can be automatically enabled. When a user upgrades from a lower version to a higher version, if we always need someone to manually toggle the PERM, it looks cumbersome and probably will not scale. Is there documentation on how to automatically enable this PERM on upgrade to specific org editions.

body.text: @Theresa Vietvu​ Can you share any documentation on how this can be automatically enabled. When a user upgrades from a lower version to a higher version, if we always need someone to manually toggle the PERM, it looks cumbersome and probably will not scale. Is there documentation on how to automatically enable this PERM on upgrade to specific org editions.

messageSegments.text: That would require updating the org perm to have the type="provisioned" and removing the attributes related to BT user access level or editaccess. Please check with

record.description: L&P is part of the Platform Services cloud. We turn features into sellable licenses and licenses into enabled features.
record.name: Licensing & Provisioning

messageSegments.text: ​ on options for running orgs through provisioning to be updated with the perm

body.text: That would require updating the org perm to have the type="provisioned" and removing the attributes related to BT user access level or editaccess. Please check with @Licensing & Provisioning​ on options for running orgs through provisioning to be updated with the perm
